Ad Text:
Senior Data Scientist

About Us:

Jemena is an Australian energy company who own and operate more than $12.4 Billion worth of gas and electricity transportation assets across Australia supplying millions of households and businesses with these essential services every day.

We pride ourselves on our innovative approach, technical expertise, and dedication to safety, quality, and sustainability. Our Group’s over 3000 team members; consistently strive to make a difference in the communities we serve. 

About the role

Are you a skilled and motivated Senior Data Scientist with a passion for developing high-performance software applications and driving data-driven decision-making?

We are seeking a talented individual to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to fuel our organisations growth. 

Develop software applications to support data-driven and efficient management of the Jemena Electricity Network, such as network modelling and visualisation.
Collaborate closely with Asset Management Engineers, Operational personnel, and IT staff responsible for real-time IT systems (SCADA, AMI, OMS, DMS), and platforms.
Play an integral role in enhancing data-driven decision-making and optimizing the operation of the Jemena Electricity Network. 

A little about you:

Ideally you will have the following:

Ideally an Electrical Engineering, Data Analytics or Computer Science degree with a sound understanding of electricity network distribution and advanced metering technologies.
Significant experience in writing and maintaining high performance, multicore applications in R and Python/PySpark.
Significant experience in developing advanced analytics applications such as real time analytics and machine learning.
Significant experience in leading software design, development and lifecycle management in a team environment.
Proficiency in Unix, HTML, SQL. Databricks, and AWS will be highly regarded along with working knowledge of various data analysis techniques and methodologies, such as time series analysis, forecasting, tree analysis, ML, vector & geospatial analysis.
Proficient in strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, adept at presenting complex information concisely. 

Qualifications:

Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, or Computing Science.
Post graduate qualification in Data Analytics desirable.

Why you should come and work for us 

Our people are our energy source and we offer meaningful benefits and rewards that work for you. We offer the opportunity for long term career growth as part of our talent development and succession planning process. 

We are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we are part of. We welcome applications from people of all ages, backgrounds, abilities, and identities. At Jemena, you belong.

Organisation: 
We are partnering with a large, values-led institution with a long-standing presence and a modern, growth-oriented outlook. The organisation operates across multiple locations and portfolios and plays a significant role in supporting communities, skills development, and long-term economic outcomes.
Finance is a trusted partner to the business, not a back-office function. The team is embedded in strategic planning, investment decisions, and performance discussions, and is expected to challenge, influence and add value.

Position:
It is an opportunity to sit at the centre of strategy, performance, and governance within a large, multi-portfolio organisation with a complex operating environment and a meaningful public purpose.

As Financial Planning & Reporting Lead, you will partner closely with the CFO, Head of Commercial Finance, and senior executive leadership to shape financial direction, elevate decision-making, and strengthen the organisation’s medium- and long-term financial position. Your work will directly inform executive forums and governing bodies, influencing outcomes at the highest level.

Your remit will include:

Owning executive-level management reporting for senior leadership and governing committees, delivering concise, decision-ready insights
Leading medium-term financial strategy, including budgets, forecasts, scenario modelling, and risk analysis
Acting as a strategic partner to executive stakeholders across revenue planning, investment decisions, and performance management
Designing and improving planning, budgeting, and forecasting frameworks to increase accuracy, agility, and confidence in decision-making
Developing sophisticated financial models, costings, and business cases to support new initiatives and optimise resource allocation
Playing a leadership role in major system and reporting transformation initiatives, with a strong focus on automation and data integrity
Championing disciplined financial management, value-for-money principles, and continuous improvement across the organisation
Candidate:

CA or CPA qualification
Significant experience in FP&A within large, complex organisations (public sector or similar)
Industry experience in environments such as health, education, or service-based institutions
Advanced expertise in financial modelling, forecasting, and scenario analysis across large datasets and enterprise systems
A proven ability to prepare and present high-impact financial insights to executive leaders and governance forums
Strong commercial acumen, sound judgement, and the confidence to influence senior stakeholders
The ability to operate autonomously in ambiguous environments while maintaining rigour and attention to detail
How to apply:
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Will Nichols at wnichols@sharpandcarter.com.au
